byline.original: By NATHANIEL POPPER and MICHAEL CORKERY

abstract: Federal Reserve contends nation's 33 largest banks can endure severe recession; regulators say banks could lose as much as $526 billion and remain in relatively good financial health, due to stockpiled cash.
lead_paragraph: In its annual stress tests, the Fed looked at how America’s 33 largest banks would do in a recession with sustained high unemployment and negative interest rates.

headline.main: Nation’s Biggest Banks Would All Withstand Recession, Fed Says
headline.print_headline: Fed Says Big Banks Can Endure a Recession

snippet: In its annual stress tests, the Fed looked at how America’s 33 largest banks would do in a recession with sustained high unemployment and negative interest rates.

keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
